Class Classifier

java.lang.Object
bartMachine.Classifier
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
bartMachine_a_base, bartMachineRegressionMultThread
public abstract class Classifier extends Object implements Serializable
The base class for all machine learning / statistical-learning algorithms. Extend this class to add your own implementation.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Field Details

    • ON_WINDOWS

      public static final boolean ON_WINDOWS
      Are we on a Windows machine (sometimes this matters)

    • MISSING_VALUE

      public static final double MISSING_VALUE
      The way we represent missing values from within our implementation
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • X_y

      protected transient ArrayList<double[]> X_y
      an array of the raw training data by ROW i.e. consisting of xi = [xi1, ..., xiM, yi]

    • X_y_by_col

      protected transient ArrayList<double[]> X_y_by_col
      an array of the raw training data by COLUMN i.e. consisting of xj = [x1j, ..., xnj] with the last entry being [y1, ..., yn]

    • y_orig

      protected transient double[] y_orig
      the raw responses

    • y_trans

      protected transient double[] y_trans
      the responses transformed (only if necessary)

    • n

      protected int n
      the number of records in the training set

    • p

      protected int p
      the number of features / predictors in the training set

    • unique_name

      protected String unique_name
      the name of this classifier (useful for debugging)

  • Constructor Details

    • Classifier

      public Classifier()
      A dummy constructor which keeps Serializable happy

  • Method Details

    • isMissing

      public static boolean isMissing(double x)
      Is this value missing?
      Parameters:
      x - The value we wish to check if it is missing
      Returns:
      True if the value is missing

    • addTrainingDataRow

      public void addTrainingDataRow(String[] x_i)
      Adds an observation / record to the training data array. The observation is converted to doubles and the entries that are unrecognized are converted to MISSING_VALUE's.
      Parameters:
      x_i - The observation / record to be added as a String array.

    • finalizeTrainingData

      public void finalizeTrainingData()
      This method finalizes the training data after all records have been added via the method addTrainingDataRow(String[]).

    • setData

      public void setData(ArrayList<double[]> X_y)
      This method sets the training data of this machine learning classifier. It also populates many essential fields such as n, p, y_orig, X_y and X_y_by_col.
      Parameters:
      X_y - The list of double vectors to be set as the training data.

    • Build

      public abstract void Build()
      build the machine learning classifier (implemented by a daughter class), you must set the data first

    • suppressOrWriteToDebugLog

      public void suppressOrWriteToDebugLog()
      Useful for debugging only. Undocumented. For details see Redirecting System.out and System.err.

    • FlushData

      protected abstract void FlushData()
      deletes all data that's unneeded at this point in runtime in order to save memory

    • Evaluate

      public abstract double Evaluate(double[] record, int num_cores)
      After the classifier has been built, new records can be evaluated / predicted (implemented by a daughter class)
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      num_cores - The number of processor cores to be used during the evaluation / prediction
      Returns:
      The prediction

    • Evaluate

      public double[] Evaluate(double[][] records, int num_cores)
      Evaluate multiple records at once. Subclasses should override this for performance.
      Parameters:
      records - The observations to be evaluated
      num_cores - The number of processor cores to use
      Returns:
      The predictions

    • Evaluate

      public double Evaluate(double[] record)
      A wrapper for Evaluate(double[], int) where one processor core is used
      Parameters:
      record - The observation to be evaluated / predicted
      Returns:
      The prediction

    • getResponseFromRecord

      public double getResponseFromRecord(double[] record)
      Given a data record, return the Y (response) value i.e. take the last index
      Parameters:
      record - the data record
      Returns:
      the data record's response value (or class)

    • StopBuilding

      public abstract void StopBuilding()
      Stop the classifier during its building phase

    • getP

      public int getP()
      How many features are in the training data set?
      Returns:
      The number of features in the training data set

    • getN

      public int getN()
      How many observations are in the training data set?
      Returns:
      The number of observations in the training data set

    • dumpDataToFile

      public void dumpDataToFile(String optional_title)
      Useful for debugging. Undocumented

    • calculateInSampleLoss

      public double calculateInSampleLoss(Classifier.ErrorTypes type_of_error_rate, int num_cores_evaluate)
      Calculates the in-sample error based on a specified error metric
      Parameters:
      type_of_error_rate - The error metric to use to compute loss
      num_cores_evaluate - The number of processor cores to use
      Returns:
      The in-sample loss as a sum total across all training observations

    • transformResponseVariable

      protected void transformResponseVariable()
      Transforms the response variable (implemented by a daughter class). The default here is to just save the original response.

    • un_transform_y

      protected double un_transform_y(double y_i)
      Untransforms a response value (implemented by a daughter class). The default here is to just return the original response.
      Parameters:
      y_i - The value to untransform
      Returns:
      The untransformed value

    • clone

      public Classifier clone()
      Overrides:
      clone in class Object

    • setUniqueName

      public void setUniqueName(String unique_name)

    • writeStdOutToLogFile

      public void writeStdOutToLogFile()
